newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Q2 GDP up 1.7 pct vs Q1 - IBGE. [Corrected 19:53 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Brazil Q2 GDP up 1.7 pct vs Q1 - IBGE. [Corrected 19:53 gmt]

text.p: The Brazilian gross domestic product (GDP) in the second quarter of 1996 was up 1.7 (corrects from 1.65) percent from the first quarter and 2.3 percent higher than in the second quarter of 1995, the National Statistics Institute (IBGE) said.
These figures reflect the economic recovery which started to become evident in the fourth quarter of 1995, the IBGE said in a statement.
It said the increased economic growth was the result of an easing in monetary policy which brought lower interest rates and fewer credit restrictions since the middle of last year.
All sectors of the economy increased growth in the second quarter, except for financial institutions which experienced a fall of 2.6 percent, the IBGE said.
The greatest increase was in civil construction, up 3.7 percent and transport, up 3.6 percent and animal production, up 3.6 percent.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
